definition_en: Someone who is slow; a sluggard.
meanings_ja: くじけない（精神的な意味）
example: The slow bus was late again. / そのバスはまた遅れました。

definition_en: Any part of something that is smaller or slimmer than the rest, now usually with anatomical reference to the back.
example: This is a small dog. / これは小さな犬です。

definition_en: Of a measurement: approximately, roughly.
example: I'm going to buy some books. / 私は何冊かの本を買う。

definition_en: Short in length of time from the present.
example: I'll finish my homework soon. /わたしは今晩すぐに宿題を終わします。

definition_en: (heading) Of time.
example: The new office space was designed for teamwork. / 新しいオフィス空間はチームワークのために設計された。

definition_en: The beginning of an activity.
example: I'm going to start my new job next Monday. / 私は来週月曜日から新しい仕事を始めます。

definition_en: A stopping place.
example: I'm at the station, waiting for my train. / 私は駅にいて、私の電車を待っています。

definition_en: A period of calm or silence.
example: I'm still learning Japanese. / 私はまだ日本語を学んでいます。
I'll take a t of tea, please. / ちょっとのティーをください。

definition_en: A challenge, trial.
example: The new software needs to be tested thoroughly before it's released. / 新しいソフトウェアは徹底的に検査してからリリースされる必要があります。

definition_en: A challenge, trial.
example: The company conducts regular tests to ensure product quality. / その会社は製品の質を確かめるために定期的に実践問題を行う。

definition_en: Abbreviation of table header.
example: The Thames River flows through London. / テスズの河はロンドンを流れる。

definition_en: At that time; then.
meanings_ja: 比較に使用される接続詞
example: I like this cake more than that one. / 私はこれ以上あのものを好みます。

definition_en: An expression of appreciation; a thought.
example: I want to thank you for your help. / あなたの助けを感謝したいです。

definition_en: Something being indicated that is there; one of those.
example: "What do you think that I am?" / "あなたは私を何と思ってるの?"

definition_en: With a comparative or with more and a verb phrase, establishes a correlation with one or more other such comparatives.
example: The book is on the table. / 本はテーブルにあります。

definition_en: (plural) Those ones.
example: I gave the book to them. / 私は彼らに本をあげた。

definition_en: Used in comparisons, to introduce the basis of comparison.
example: I'll call you when I get there, then I'll meet you. / 私はそこに到着するまで電話をかけてから、貴方と会います。

definition_en: That place.
example: There is a park there. / そこには公園がある。

definition_en: (the third-person plural) A group of people, animals, plants or objects previously mentioned.
meanings_ja: 自分たちの、自分の、所有する
example: They are going to the store. / 彼らは店に行く。

definition_en: Something being indicated that is here; one of these.
example: This book is mine. / 私のこの本は自分のものです。

definition_en: (demonstrative) The thing, person, idea, quality, event, action or time indicated or understood from context, especially if more remote geographically, temporally or mentally than one designated as "this", or if expressing distinction.
meanings_ja: 一群の, 何かに関するもの
example: "Those who love music are always happy." / "音楽を愛する人々は常に幸福です。"

definition_en: To ponder, to go over in one's head.
example: "She had a thought about quitting her job." / 彼女は彼女の仕事を辞めることを考えた。

definition_en: The inevitable progression into the future with the passing of present and past events.
example: What's the right time for our meeting? / その会議の開催時間は何時ですか？

definition_en: The inevitable progression into the future with the passing of present and past events.
example: The company has had times of prosperity. / 会社は繁栄の時期を経験した。

definition_en: Toward a closed, touching or engaging position.
example: I'm going to the store. / 私は店に行く。

definition_en: The highest or uppermost part of something.
example: The top of the mountain is very steep. / 山頂は非常に陥れる。

definition_en: The digit/figure 2.
example: I have two apples. / 私は2個のリンゴがあります。

definition_en: Being lower; being beneath something.
example: The book is under my bed. / 私のベッドの下に本があります。

definition_en: (personal) Me and at least one other person; the objective case of we.
example: The people in the room turned to us for instructions. / 室内の人は私たちに指示を求めた。

definition_en: True, real, actual.
example: The weather was very hot. / 天気はとても暑かった。

definition_en: Television, television show, movie.
example: I watched a video about space exploration. / 宇宙探査についての映像を見た。

definition_en: Television, television show, movie.
example: I watched the videos on YouTube yesterday. / 私は昨日YouTubeで動画を見ました。

definition_en: A delay.
example: I will wait for you at the station. / スタジオであなたを待ちます。
She was a teacher. / 彼女は教師だった。

definition_en: To look at, see, or view for a period of time.
example: I'm watching a movie tonight. / 今夜は映画を見ている。

definition_en: A substance (of molecular formula H₂O) found at room temperature and pressure as a clear liquid; it is present naturally as rain, and found in rivers, lakes and seas; its solid form is ice and its gaseous form is steam.
example: The water is fine today. / 今日の水は上手です。

definition_en: (personal) The speakers/writers, or the speaker/writer and at least one other person (not the person being addressed). (This is the exclusive we.)
example: We are going to the park. / 私たちは公園に行きます。

definition_en: In good health.
example: The well was dry. / 水が干物だった。

definition_en: A man, a husband
example: If I were you, I would not do that. / 私はあなたがしたらそんなことをしない

definition_en: Liquid or moisture.
example: The wet road made it hard to drive. / 乗りづらい道になった。

definition_en: (Singlish) Used to contradict an underlying assumption held by the interlocutor.
example: What's your favorite food? / お好きな食べ物は何ですか？

definition_en: The place in which something happens.
example: Where did you go? / ドコ行ったの？

definition_en: (interrogative) What one or ones (of those mentioned or implied).
example: Which book do you want to read? / あなたが読みたい本は何ですか？

definition_en: (now uncommon or literary) To wish, desire (something).
example: I will go to Tokyo tomorrow. / 私は明日東京に行く。

definition_en: Along, together with others, in a group, etc.
example: I'll go to the store with my friend. / 私は友達と共に店に行きます。

definition_en: To conquer, defeat.
example: I won the tournament. /私はトーナメントを優勝した。

definition_en: The smallest unit of language that has a particular meaning and can be expressed by itself; the smallest discrete, meaningful unit of language. (contrast morpheme.)
example: The words she spoke were very encouraging. / 彼女が話した文句は非常に励ましやすかった。

definition_en: (heading) Employment.
example: I need to work on my presentation today. / 私は今このプレゼンテーションに取り組む必要があります。

definition_en: To do a specific task by employing physical or mental powers.
example: She worked all night to finish the project. / 彼女は夜通しプロジェクトを完成させた。

definition_en: (usually in the plural) Operation; action.
example: I'm working on a project this weekend. / ウィークエンドにはプロジェクトを仕事しています。

definition_en: (with "the") Human collective existence; existence in general.
example: The world is full of wonder. / 世界は驚嘆に満ちている。

definition_en: Something that would happen, or would be the case, under different circumstances; a potentiality.
example: I would go to the party tonight. / 今晩のパーティーに GOする。

definition_en: A solar year, the time it takes the Earth to complete one revolution of the Sun (between 365.24 and 365.26 days depending on the point of reference).
example: The company has been growing steadily over the past year. / その会社は過去一年間順調に成長しています。

definition_en: To address (a person) using the pronoun you (in the past, especially to use you rather than thou, when you was considered more formal).
example: You're going to love this movie! / お前はこの映画が大好きだろう！
This is your book. / これはあなたの本です。

definition_en: Suitableness.
example: He has a great ability to solve puzzles. / 彼はパズルの解答力が非常に高くいます。

definition_en: To give as its foundation or starting point; to lay the foundation of.
example: The company's decisions are based on careful research. / その会社は注意深い調査に基づいて決断する。

definition_en: A living creature.
example: "She's being very kind to me." / 彼女は私に対してとても優しいです。

definition_en: (ditransitive) To transport toward somebody/somewhere.
example: I'm bringing my A-game to this meeting. / 私は、この会議で全力疾走します。

definition_en: A person who builds or constructs things.
example: The company is a leading builder of solar panels. / その会社は太陽電池の主要な建設者です。

definition_en: A completed survey.
example: The project will be complete by next year. / そのプロジェクトは来年までに完了します。

definition_en: (manner) In a complete manner
example: I'm completely exhausted from traveling all day. / 私は旅行のために疲れきりしまった。

definition_en: Influence or authority over something.
example: The company wants to control the market share. / 会社は市場シェアを支配したい。

definition_en: A patron, a client; one who purchases or receives a product or service from a business or merchant, or intends to do so.
example: Our company is dedicated to serving our customers with top-notch products and services. / 私たちの会社は、最高の製品とサービスで貴重な顧客をサポートしています。

definition_en: A stage of proficiency or qualification in a course of study, now especially an award bestowed by a university or, in some countries, a college, as a certification of academic achievement. (In the United States, can include secondary schools.)
example: I'm working on my degree in computer science. / コンピューター科学の学位を目指しています。

definition_en: A part, portion, or subdivision.
meanings_ja:
部署 (buchika): 主要な意味
学術分野 (gakujutsu bunya) - 学問や研究の分野
経営部門 (keiei bumon) -ビジネスや企業の組織

例文: The company has a new department for sustainable energy. / 会社は新しい持続可能なエネルギーに関する部署を持っています。
example: The company has a new department for sustainable energy. / 会社は新しい持続可能なエネルギーに関する部署を持っています。

definition_en: A specification of an object or process, referring to requirements to be satisfied and thus conditions to be met for them to solve a problem.
meanings_ja: デザイン（芸術的なもの）、デザイン（商業的もの）
example: The company wants to redesign its logo. / その会社はロゴを再設計したい。

definition_en: Something small enough to escape casual notice.
example: Can you provide more details about the project? / プロジェクトに関する詳細を教えてください。

definition_en: To last, continue, endure.
example: I studied during my summer vacation. / 私は夏休み中に勉強しました。

definition_en: At a time in advance of the usual or expected event.
example: I need to finish this project earlier. /私はこのプロジェクトを遅らせないでおきたい。

definition_en: (usually plural) A container, especially a bottle, whose contents have been used up, leaving it empty.
example: The room was empty when I got there. / 実際には誰もいませんでした。

definition_en: A large construction used in warfare, such as a battering ram, catapult etc.
example: The car's engine is powerful. / 車の機関はパワフルです。

definition_en: The "Enter" key on a computer keyboard.
example: She enters the room confidently. / 她は自信を持って部屋に入る。

definition_en: (manner) In a special manner; specially.
example: I'm especially interested in this project. /私はこのプロジェクトに特に興味を持っています。

definition_en: Alternative form of etc.
example: I like reading books, watching movies, etc. / 僕は本を読み、映画を見ている、そのほか

definition_en: (diminutive) An even number.
meanings_ja: また、同じように、ある程度まで継続
example: I like even numbers. / 私は等しい数字を好きです。

definition_en: To stir the emotions of.
example: I'm excited for the concert tonight! / 今夜のコンサートは楽しみです!

definition_en: To predict or believe that something will happen
example: The weather was expected to be sunny, but it rained. / 天気は晴れと期待されていたが、雨が降った。

definition_en: The effect upon the judgment or feelings produced by any event, whether witnessed or participated in; personal and direct impressions as contrasted with description or fancies; personal acquaintance; actual enjoyment or suffering.
example: I had a great experience hiking in the mountains. / 私は山に登り、すごい実際の経験をしました。

definition_en: A final examination; a test or examination given at the end of a term or class; the test that concludes a class.
example: The final exam was very difficult. / 最終の試験は非常に難しかった。

definition_en: Strength or energy of body or mind; active power; vigour; might; capacity of exercising an influence or producing an effect.
example: The government must use force to maintain order in the city. / 市内で秩序を維持するため、政府は推力を使用しなければならない。

definition_en: (heading, physical) To do with shape.
example: The company will send you an application form to apply for the job. / その会社は、職を応募するための申請書を送らせます。

definition_en: One of the eight players (comprising two props, one hooker, two locks, two flankers and one number eight, collectively known as the pack) whose primary task is to gain and maintain possession of the ball (compare back).
meanings_ja: はっきりした進歩を遂げる
将来に向かって行動する
example: I'm moving forward with my plans. / 私の計画を進める

definition_en: A general fact or proposition; a generality.
example: The general manager of the company made a public announcement. / その会社の上級マネージャーが公共の発表を行った。

definition_en: (ditransitive) To move, shift, provide something abstract or concrete to someone or something or somewhere.
example: The test was given to me yesterday. /昨日、私には試験が与えられた。

definition_en: The body with the power to make and/or enforce laws to control a country, land area, people or organization.
example: The government has implemented new policies to stimulate economic growth. / 新しい経済成長を刺激するために、政府は新しい政策を実施した。

definition_en: The surface of the Earth, as opposed to the sky or water or underground.
example: The aircraft landed safely on the ground. / 航空機は安全に土地に着陸した。

definition_en: (stative) To perceive sounds through the ear.
example: The court gave the company a hearing to explain their side of the story. /裁判所は企業に対して訴えの説明を行うための聴き取り口会議を与えた。

definition_en: To provide assistance to (someone or something).
example: I'm happy to be helping you with your project. / 私はあなたのプロジェクトに手を貸しています。

definition_en: An optical or other representation of a real object; a graphic; a picture.
example: The company's images of success were shattered when their product failed. / その会社の成功像は、製品が失敗したことで崩れた。

definition_en: A piece of source code or other content that is dynamically retrieved for inclusion in another item.
example: The new policy includes benefits for all employees. / 新しいポリシーには、全員に有効な特典が含まれる。

definition_en: A piece of source code or other content that is dynamically retrieved for inclusion in another item.
example: The new policy includes all employees. / 新しいポリシーには全ての社員を含む。

definition_en: In the place of something (usually mentioned earlier); as a substitute or alternative.
meanings_ja: その他の選択肢があることを示す
example: I'll take a book instead of going out. / 私は出るのではなく、書籍を読むことにします。

definition_en: A distinct physical object.
example: I need to make a list of all the items we need to buy. / 私には買うべきアイテムのリストを作らなければ。

definition_en: (reflexive pronoun) it; A thing as the object of a verb or preposition that also appears as the subject
example: The company is evaluating itself to improve its performance. / その会社は、パフォーマンスを上げるために自己評価を行っている。

definition_en: A set amount of travelling, seen as a single unit; a discrete trip, a voyage.
example: I'm on a journey to discover my passion. / 私は私のパッションを発見する旅の途中です。

definition_en: Of considerable or relatively great size or extent.
example: The largest company in Japan is Toyota. / 日本最大の会社はトヨタです。

definition_en: An act of lifting or raising.
example: I need to get up to the 5th floor, so I'll take the lift. / 5階まで行く必要があるので、エレベーターを乗ります。

definition_en: A military rank between captain and lieutenant colonel.
example: The company is a major player in the industry. / その会社は業界の主要な存在です。

definition_en: To intend.
meanings_ja: 実際に目的（目的を持つ）
example: I didn't mean to hurt your feelings. / 私はあなたの傷心を 意地悪いわけではありません。

definition_en: To change place or posture; to go, in any manner, from one place or position to another.
example: The company is moving to a new office. / 会社は新しい事務所に移転します。

definition_en: (usually with the definite article) A place to do the "necessary" business of urination and defecation: an outhouse or lavatory.
example: I need a new phone, so it's necessary to upgrade. / 私は新しい電話が必要だから、アップグレードする必要があります。

definition_en: A chance for advancement, progress or profit.
example: This is a great opportunity for us to invest in the market. / これは私たちの投資に最適の機会です。

definition_en: Someone who is associated with another in a common activity or interest.
example: We're looking for a partner to help us with our project. / 我々はプロジェクトのパートナーを探しています。

definition_en: A trail for the use of, or worn by, pedestrians.
example: The path to success is not easy. / 成功の道は容易ではない。

definition_en: A part of a larger whole, usually in such a form that it is able to be separated from other parts.
example: The puzzle had many pieces that didn't fit. / プズルは合わない小さな部分が多くあった。

definition_en: A possible one.
example: It's possible that I'll get the job. / 私が採用される可能性がある。

definition_en: Having, or capable of exerting power, potency or influence.
example: She's a powerful speaker who can inspire her audience. / 彼女は、聴衆に感動させる強いスピーカーです。

definition_en: Preparation
example: I will prepare my presentation before the meeting. / 会議前にプレゼンテーションを準備します。

definition_en: A soldier of the lowest rank in the army.
example: The hotel room was private and luxurious. / そのホテルルームは個people的なで、豪華だった。

definition_en: To keep safe; to defend; to guard; to prevent harm coming to.
meanings_ja:
Here is the Japanese translation of the English word "protect":

意味1: (mamoru) - to defend or guard something from harm or damage
意味2: (mamori) - to keep someone or something safe from injury or danger

例文: I will protect my child from harm. / 子供を害することなく守る。

Note that "protect" can also mean "to preserve or conserve" something, but this is a less common usage of the word.
example: I will protect my child from harm. / 子供を害することなく守る。

definition_en: Feeling honoured (by something); feeling happy or satisfied about an event or fact; gratified.
example: I'm proud of my accomplishment. / 私の成果を自負しています。

definition_en: (heading) To the greatest extent or degree; completely, entirely.
example: The weather is quite hot today. / 今日はとても暑いです。

definition_en: About, regarding, with reference to; especially in letters, documents and emails.
example: I need to re-write this essay. / 私はこのエッセイを再書く必要があります。

definition_en: The act of stretching or extending; extension.
example: The company wants to reach more customers through social media. / コングロマイトはソーシャルメディアを通じて更多のカスターマーを手に取りたい。

definition_en: Having happened a short while ago.
example: The recent news was shocking. / 最新のニュースはショック的だった。

definition_en: Diligent inquiry or examination to seek or revise facts, principles, theories, applications, etc.; laborious or continued search after truth.
example: The company will invest $10 million in research to develop new technology. / その会社は新技術の開発を目指し、10万ドルを投資する。

definition_en: The act of returning.
example: I will return the book next week. / 私は来週本を返す。

definition_en: To pronounce.
example: The company's new policy is just a saying. / その会社の新しい政策はただの言葉に過ぎない。

definition_en: A cutting; a part cut out from the rest of something.
example: The new section of the park will open in June. / 新しい公園の部屋は6月に開設します。

definition_en: An act of being of assistance to someone.
example: Can I help you with any service? / 私には何のサービスでもお助けできますか？

definition_en: To display, to have somebody see (something).
example: The new policy has been shown to improve employee morale. / 新しいポリシーは従業員のモラルを改善することが示されました。

definition_en: From a specified time in the past.
example: I haven't seen her since she moved to New York. / 私は彼女がニューヨークに移住して以来彼女を見ていない。

definition_en: A 45 RPM vinyl record with one song on side A and one on side B.
example: I'm a single person, but I like to socialize. / 私は一人暮らしですが、集団に遊ぶのは好きです。

definition_en: Sorrow, grief.
example: The company has a website to showcase its products. / その会社は製品を紹介するためにウェブサイトを持つ。

definition_en: To pay out (money).
example: I spent my weekend studying. / 私は週末を勉強した。

definition_en: A phase.
example: The actress stepped onto the stage, ready to begin her performance. / 舞台に立って、パフォーマンスを始める準備をした。

definition_en: A condition; a set of circumstances applying at any given time.
example: The United States is a country with 50 states. / アメリカ合衆国は50の国の内の1つです。

definition_en: An advance or movement made from one foot to the other; a pace.
example: Take the steps to get to the second floor. / 二階に登るためには床を踏み上げろ。

definition_en: The achievement of one's aim or goal.
example: The company's success was due to its innovative marketing strategy. / その会社の成功は、創新的マーケティング戦略によるものであった。

definition_en: (sometimes attributive) Something which supports.
example: The company will provide support to help you with your project. / 会社はあなたのプロジェクトを助けるためにサポートを提供します。

definition_en: A collection of organized things; a whole composed of relationships among its members.
example: The company has a strict system in place to ensure customer satisfaction. / その会社には顧客満足を確保するための厳しい組織があります。

definition_en: The organization of knowledge for practical purposes.
example: The company invests heavily in technology to improve efficiency. / その会社は効率を上げるために技術に大きな投資をしています。

definition_en: A very tall iron-framed structure, usually painted red and white, on which microwave, radio, satellite, or other communication antennas are installed; mast.
example: The tower stood tall at the edge of the city. / 市の端に高さを張るビルディングがあった。

definition_en: To attempt; to endeavour. Followed by infinitive.
example: I'm trying to learn Japanese. / 私は日本語を学習中です。

definition_en: Up to the time of (something happening).
example: I'll stay here until tomorrow. / 私は明日までここに残る。

definition_en: A stimulant, such as amphetamine, that increases energy and decreases appetite.
example: The upper class has more privileges. / 上部階級はより優遇される。

definition_en: An uncertain duration of time, a period of time.
example: I'll finish my homework while you're watching TV. / テレビを見ている間に、僕は宿題を終わします。

definition_en: A way or means of approaching or entering; an entrance; a passage.
example: The new software gave users access to advanced features. / 新ソフトウェアは、ユーザーに高度な機能を接続した。

definition_en: Having accompaniment; being part of a group of at least two.
example: I was accompanied by my friends to the party. / パーティーに行く際、私の友達と一緒にいた。

definition_en: Telling the truth or giving a true result; exact; not defective or faulty
example: The scientist's data was accurate, so we could rely on it. / 科学者のデータは正確だったため、私たちはその信頼にできた。

definition_en: An actual, real one; notably:
example: The actual results exceeded our expectations. / 我々の期待を超える実際の結果になった。

definition_en: The act of adding anything.
example: The addition of 3 + 4 is 7. / 3と4を足すと7になる。

definition_en: A forward move; improvement or progression.

example: The autonomous car drove down the street. / 自律車は通りを走った。
The US ambassador will visit Japan to strengthen ties. / アメリカ大使が日本に訪問し、絆を強化する。

definition_en: The construction and implementation of a system.
example: The company will conduct a thorough buildout to support its expansion into new markets. / その会社は、新市場進出をサポートするために徹底したプロジェクトの展開を行う。

meanings_ja: キリロの訳註 - Bullinger's most well-known work is a Greek-English interlinear Bible commentary.
プロテスタント神学者 - Henry Coley Bullinger was a prominent Protestant theologian.
example: The book of Bullinger is a valuable resource for biblical scholars. / ブリューリンガーの書は聖書研究家にとって貴重な資源です。

definition_en: The act or state of declining or sinking.
example: The drummer's cadence was perfect, keeping the band in sync. / ドラマーのリズムはピッタリで、バンドを調節していた。

meanings_ja:
I'm happy to help! 🎉

After researching, I found that "cannard" is not a commonly used English word. However, it's possible that it's a variant or misspelling of the word "canard".

Here are some possible meanings:

意味1: (jibiki) / (kansetsu)
A canard is a type of aircraft with an unusual wing design.

例文: The engineer designed a new canard to improve the plane's maneuverability. / エンジニアは、新しいjibikiを設計して、飛行機の運動性を向上させることにした。

Note that there might be other meanings or interpretations, but based on my research, this is the most likely explanation for "cannard". 🚀
example: The engineer designed a new canard to improve the plane's maneuverability. / エンジニアは、新しいjibikiを設計して、飛行機の運動性を向上させることにした。

definition_en: A mixture of different components.
example: The composite material was used to build the car's body. / その複合物は自動車の車体を建てました。

definition_en: A great flood or rain.
example: The city was hit by a deluge of rain, causing widespread flooding. / 市は大雨に襲われ、市街地が水浸しになった。

definition_en: An arrangement or classification of things.
example: The company will deploy new employees in the next quarter. / 来度四半期に新員を配置します。
The missile flew downrange and hit its target. / ミサイルは標的に向かって下流方向に飛び込んだ。

definition_en: The act of fabricating, framing, or constructing; construction; manufacture
example: The company's fabrication of the product's features was exposed. / その商品の機能を偽造した会社が暴露された。

definition_en: To smoothen or even a surface (especially a connection or junction on a surface).
example: The car's fairing helped to reduce wind resistance. / 風抵抗を低減するために車体の後部カバーが役立った。

definition_en: A structure on various parts of a vehicle, for example an aircraft, automobile, or motorcycle, that produces a smooth exterior and reduces drag
example: The spacecraft's fairings protected it during re-entry. / 宇宙船は再突入中、外装が保護した。

definition_en: The vertical clearance above someone's head, as in a tunnel, doorway etc.
example: The new skyscraper has a lot of headroom, with high ceilings and wide corridors. / 新しい超高層ビルは、高い天井と広い廊下を持っており、多くの開放性があります。

definition_en: The ability to solve difficult problems, often in original, clever, and inventive ways.
example: The company's ingenuity in solving the technical problem impressed investors. / その会社は技術的な問題を新しい力で解決することで投資家たちに印象づけました。

definition_en: To use; to exploit; to manipulate in order to take full advantage (of something).
example: The company is leveraging social media to reach new customers. / 会社は、SNSを通じて新しい顧客に向けて使い上げている。
The nucleus of an atom is made up of protons and neutrons. / アトムの原子核はプロトンとニュートロンから構成されます。

definition_en: (originally intransitive) To act optimistically or as an optimist.
meanings_ja: 速度や効率を向上させた
example: The company optimized their production process to reduce costs. / その会社はコスト削減のために生産プロセスを最適化した。

definition_en: That part of a cargo that produces revenue.
meanings_ja: cargo carried by a spacecraft or aircraft
example: The payload of the rocket was a satellite. / ロケットのペイロードは衛星でした。

definition_en: Anything that propels
meanings_ja: A substance that drives a reaction
example: The new propellant allowed the rocket to reach orbit. / 新しい推進剤でロケットは軌道に到達した。
We need to re-label these products to match our new branding strategy. / 我々は、新しいブランド戦略に適合するためにこれらの製品を並べ直さなければならない。

definition_en: The act of refurbishing; renovation.
example: The company will undertake a major refurbishment of its offices to improve efficiency. / その会社は、効率を向上させるために大規模なオフィス改修を行う。

definition_en: To say or do (something) for a second time, such as for emphasis.
example: The company reiterated its commitment to sustainability. / その企業は、持続可能性について再度述べた。

definition_en: The action or instance of soliciting; petition; proposal
meanings_ja: 質問や申し込みの行為
example: The company received many solicitation emails from potential clients. / その会社は多くの潜在的クライアントから依頼メールを受けました。
The spacecraft's survivability was crucial for the mission. / 宇宙船の生存可能性はミッションにとって重要であった。

definition_en: One who thrusts, who pushes or stabs.
example: The spacecraft's thrusters helped it maintain its orbit. / 宇宙船の推進機関は、軌道を維持するのに役立った。

definition_en: A heavy blow, punch.
example: The storm wallops the city, causing widespread damage. / 巨大な嵐が市を襲い、広範囲の被害が出る。

definition_en: Having the faculty of quick motion in the limbs; apt or ready to move
example: This new software is agile and easy to use. / この新しいソフトウェアは、flexibleで使い易しく、速くて俊敏。

definition_en: A stream or small river.
example: The teacher gave a beck to quiet down. / テACHERは静かにするよう指導した。

meanings_ja: 最先端の、最高のレベルの
example: The new smartphone is cutting-edge. / 新スマートフォンは最新技術を適用した。

definition_en: An arrangement or classification of things.
example: The company will make new deployments to expand its market share. / 会社は新しい軍隊展開を計画し、マーケットシェアを拡大する。

definition_en: A male ant, bee or wasp, which does not work but can fertilize the queen bee.
meanings_ja: 音楽的なリズムの繰り返し
example: The company uses a drone to survey the construction site. / その会社は、建物検討のために小型無人機を使用しています。

definition_en: Of, or relating to a foundation or foundations
example: This research is foundational to understanding the phenomenon. / これらの研究は現象の理解に基礎的です。

definition_en: An inauguration; a formal beginning.
example: The inaugural ceremony was held on January 1st. / 新年最初の開幕式が1月1日に開催された。

definition_en: To form into one whole; to make entire; to complete; to renew; to restore; to perfect.
example: The company is integrating its marketing efforts to increase efficiency. / その会社は、Marketing effortを一体化し、効率性を高める。

definition_en: A logistic function or graph of a logistic curve.
example: The company's logistics team ensured that all equipment was delivered on time. / その会社の貨物運送チームは、すべての機材が正しい時刻に配達されたことを確認しました。

definition_en: To match unsuitably; to fail to match
example: The company's new policy was a mismatch with its previous one, causing confusion among employees. / 会社の新しいポリシーは従来のものと一致せず、従業員らの混乱を招いた。

definition_en: To be the first to do or achieve (something), preparing the way for others to follow.
example: The company pioneered new technology in the field. / その会社はその分野で新しい技術を先駆的になった。

definition_en: Of or relating to royalty.
example: The queen's regal bearing commanded respect. / 王妃の高級な態度は、誰もが尊敬した。

definition_en: Of or pertaining to regulation.
example: The company must comply with regulatory guidelines. / 会社は調整のガイドラインに従う必要がある。

definition_en: Stucco or plaster applied to walls (mostly to outside masonry walls).
example: The new software renders 3D graphics quickly. / 新しいソフトウェアは速く3Dグラフィックを表示します。

definition_en: To protect, to defend.
example: The spacecraft's shielding protected it from harmful radiation. / 宇宙船の防護は有害な輻射から保護した。

definition_en: To display, demonstrate, show, or present.
example: The new product is showcasing its advanced features. / 新製品は優れた機能をアドバタイズしています。

definition_en: The act of landing in water, as by a space capsule or rollercoaster.
meanings_ja: 落下（水中）, 潜航艇の回収
example: The spacecraft splashdown safely on the Pacific Ocean. / 宇宙船は太平洋に安全に 陸着した。

definition_en: (sometimes derogatory) An emigrant heading west on the Oregon Trail who gave up and turned back to the east.
example: The new CEO implemented a turnaround strategy that boosted the company's profits. / 新CEOは、会社の利益をBOOSTするためのターンアラウンド戦略を実施した。

definition_en: To make use of; to use.
example: The company utilizes new technology to increase efficiency. / その会社は新しい技術を活用して効率性を高める。
